channel.title: Pradeo Blog
channel.description: Read about the lastest Mobile Security news and get tips to protect your enterprise mobile endpoints.

item.title: Opening of App Stores : What Impact on Application Security ?
item.description: The Digital Markets Act (DMA) coming into effect in March 2024 marks a decisive turning point in the European digital landscape, by regulating the practices of major digital companies, especially the "Gamam" - Google, Apple, Meta, Amazon, Microsoft. This European Union legislation targets anti-competitive behavior, with the goal of benefiting consumers and small businesses. But won’t this legislation also benefit cybercriminals?
item.content:encoded: The Digital Markets Act (DMA) coming into effect in March 2024 marks a decisive turning point in the European digital landscape, by regulating the practices of major digital companies, especially the "Gamam" - Google, Apple, Meta, Amazon, Microsoft. This European Union legislation targets anti-competitive behavior, with the goal of benefiting consumers and small businesses. But won’t this legislation also benefit cybercriminals?
item.author: roxane@pradeo.com (Roxane Suau)

item.title: 42Gears and Pradeo : Partner for Advanced Mobile Security
item.description: The Pradeo team is proud to announce that its threat detection and response capabilities are now directly available within the 42Gears UEM solution.
item.content:encoded: The Pradeo team is proud to announce that its threat detection and response capabilities are now directly available within the 42Gears UEM solution.
item.author: stephane.saad@pradeo.com (Stéphane Saad)

item.title: Cyber security trends and predictions for 2024
item.description: While preparedness remains one of the most important facets of effective organizational cybersecurity, it can be difficult to plan for the year ahead with so many unknowns. To help you approach this new year, our CEO Clement SAAD shares his vision of 2024 mobile security trends and predictions.
item.content:encoded: While preparedness remains one of the most important facets of effective organizational cybersecurity, it can be difficult to plan for the year ahead with so many unknowns. To help you approach this new year, our CEO Clement SAAD shares his vision of 2024 mobile security trends and predictions.
item.author: roxane@pradeo.com (Roxane Suau)

item.title: New Release: Mobile Source Code Audit
item.description: One year after the acquisition of Yagaan, expert in source code analysis, Pradeo enhances its mobile application security services by supporting its first mobile language.
item.content:encoded: One year after the acquisition of Yagaan, expert in source code analysis, Pradeo enhances its mobile application security services by supporting its first mobile language.
item.dc:creator: Caroline Borriello

item.title: Quishing: when a QR code becomes a trap
item.description: The threat landscape is evolving by the day. The latest phenomenon, Quishing, exploits QR codes to trick their target. These widely used codes are a simple and effective way to link the physical and digital worlds. They are used on packaging, posters and even business cards to easily direct their audience to a website. This practical, democratized tool is being hijacked by cybercriminals, becoming a new threat to users. But what exactly is Quishing?
item.content:encoded: The threat landscape is evolving by the day. The latest phenomenon, Quishing, exploits QR codes to trick their target. These widely used codes are a simple and effective way to link the physical and digital worlds. They are used on packaging, posters and even business cards to easily direct their audience to a website. This practical, democratized tool is being hijacked by cybercriminals, becoming a new threat to users. But what exactly is Quishing?
item.dc:creator: Caroline Borriello

item.title: Pradeo wins the hackathon organized by Campus Cyber and the DGSE
item.description: Campus Cyber and the French secret service, the  Direction Générale de Sécurité Extérieure (DGSE) joined forces for the CacheCache hackathon held from the 8th to the 15th of November 2023. This inaugural edition showcased mobile security by presenting a high-stakes challenge to 10 carefully selected French companies. On Wednesday, November 15th, an expert jury, which received daily reports from the participating teams, heard their final presentations before selecting the winners.
item.content:encoded: Campus Cyber and the French secret service, the  Direction Générale de Sécurité Extérieure (DGSE) joined forces for the CacheCache hackathon held from the 8th to the 15th of November 2023. This inaugural edition showcased mobile security by presenting a high-stakes challenge to 10 carefully selected French companies. On Wednesday, November 15th, an expert jury, which received daily reports from the participating teams, heard their final presentations before selecting the winners.
item.dc:creator: Caroline Borriello

item.title: Temu, what to take away from this new controversy?
item.description:
In recent weeks, the Chinese application Temu has come under inspection, fueling the debate on the intrusive nature of certain applications and the risk of sensitive data exfiltration. 

With over 100 million downloads in the last 9 months in Europe and the United States, this ultra-competitive e-commerce application is challenging AliExpress and Shein and highlights the rapid adoption of mobile applications. 

The report published by the American company Grizzly Research last September raises concerns by suspecting Temu of massive data exfiltration, resembling espionage. The research firm invokes the precautionary principle and calls for the removal of the application, which could potentially harm the interests of the United States.
item.content:encoded:
In recent weeks, the Chinese application Temu has come under inspection, fueling the debate on the intrusive nature of certain applications and the risk of sensitive data exfiltration. 

With over 100 million downloads in the last 9 months in Europe and the United States, this ultra-competitive e-commerce application is challenging AliExpress and Shein and highlights the rapid adoption of mobile applications. 

The report published by the American company Grizzly Research last September raises concerns by suspecting Temu of massive data exfiltration, resembling espionage. The research firm invokes the precautionary principle and calls for the removal of the application, which could potentially harm the interests of the United States.
item.dc:creator: Caroline Borriello

item.title: SpyNote malware now targeting banking applications
item.description:
Since June, a surge of SpyNote infections targeting banking applications has been reported. A new version of the spyware distributed through email phishing or smishing (by SMS) campaigns is now specifically designed to commit banking fraud.

SpyNote is a family of dangerous Android malware, first sold on the dark web in 2021. After the source code was leaked in 2022, multiple variants came in circulation. The latest of these variants is targeting specifically financial institutions, such as HSBC, Deutsche Bank, Kotak Bank, BurlaNubank and Bank of America.
item.content:encoded:
Since June, a surge of SpyNote infections targeting banking applications has been reported. A new version of the spyware distributed through email phishing or smishing (by SMS) campaigns is now specifically designed to commit banking fraud.

SpyNote is a family of dangerous Android malware, first sold on the dark web in 2021. After the source code was leaked in 2022, multiple variants came in circulation. The latest of these variants is targeting specifically financial institutions, such as HSBC, Deutsche Bank, Kotak Bank, BurlaNubank and Bank of America.

item.title: Pradeo recognized in 2023 Gartner Peer Insights™ Voice of the Customer for Mobile Threat Defense
item.description:
Pradeo is proud to be recognized as a Strong Performer in recent Gartner Peer Insights Voice of the Customer for Mobile Threat Defense report, published in July 2023. 

The excellent reviews received from Pradeo’s various customers, including CISOs, IT Security and Risk Managers, and Data Analysts, emphasize its objective to delivering reliable mobile endpoint detection and response, and underscore its dedication to technology efficiency and customer satisfaction.

item.title: Two spyware tied with China found hiding on the Google Play Store
item.description: This week, our engine detected two spyware hiding on the Google Play Store and affecting up to 1.5 million users. Both applications are from the same developer, pose as file management applications and feature similar malicious behaviors. They are programmed to launch without users’ interaction, and to silently exfiltrate sensitive users’ data towards various malicious servers based in China. We have alerted Google of the discovery before publishing this alert.
item.content:encoded: This week, our engine detected two spyware hiding on the Google Play Store and affecting up to 1.5 million users. Both applications are from the same developer, pose as file management applications and feature similar malicious behaviors. They are programmed to launch without users’ interaction, and to silently exfiltrate sensitive users’ data towards various malicious servers based in China. We have alerted Google of the discovery before publishing this alert.
